Content:: In anatomy, a fossa (/ˈfɒsə/;[1][2] plural fossae (/ˈfɒsiː/ or /ˈfɒsaɪ/); from Latin fossa, "ditch" or "trench") is a depression or hollow, usually in a bone, such as the hypophyseal fossa (the depression in the sphenoid bone).[3] Some examples include: In the Skull: In the Mandible: In the Torso: In the Upper Limb: In the Lower Limb:
Title: Fossa (anatomy) - Wikipedia
